data.title: Beautiful flowers
data.text: Such a pretty place to visit.  Walk around and see the lovely flowers and building sitting on the lake.

data.title: Hollis Gardens
data.text: Beautiful place to spend afternoon enjoying the scenery the amazing variety of flowers and relaxing...Many people reserve park for wedding, lots of photo ops..

data.title: Beautiful!
data.text: I have been to Hollis Gardens twice. Once in April and once in October. In April the flowers were much more vibrant! Beautiful both times. Grounds are well maintained. Relaxing. Peaceful.

data.title: Flowers
data.text: This place is so pretty.  It is the best place I know in Lakeland to go and get pictures made and see beautiful scenery.  Nice and peaceful and pretty.

data.title: Hollis Garden
data.text: If you are in or near downtown Lakeland, this beautiful little formal garden is a great place for a short, relaxing stroll. The gardeners keep the grounds in excellent condition and rotate the plantings seasonally with a surprising assortment of specimens.  The garden is free. If you want a longer walk, Lake Mirror is right there and Lake Morton is just down the street. Closed on Mondays. Open 10:00 a.m. - around dusk.

data.title: Relaxing time
data.text: Relaxing and peaceful, spend hours with my husband taking pictures and enjoying nature. Beautiful place.

data.title: Great little spot if you're in the are. Tricky with a toddler on foot
data.text: We visited with my parents and 15 month old daughter as part of an afternoon in Lakeland whilst staying in Kissimmee. We started our visit to Lakeland here, there is free parking here which allows immediate access to this garden, Lake Mirror and Barnet Family Park. It was a really sweet little garden, with a great use of space. A really nice place to take photographs. The paths aren't really suited for a toddler on foot, although fine for the buggy. There is a lawn which she could run around in without causing problems, and a small pond with fish which she found fascinating. It's small enough and close enough to the play park that you can visit with a toddler, enjoy the gardens yourself before a walk around the lake and/or visit to the play park. Definitely worth a short visit if you're in the area, but it wasn't worth the 40 minute drive from Kissimmee.

data.title: Bad day to rate this
data.text: Today I would actually rate this a 3 because there was a festival going on right next to the Gardens and it was LOUD music.  Also, they were cutting the grass  at 3 pm.  So we couldn't hear the relaxing music.  It is a pretty place, would be even nicer if more of the plants had name plaques.  Pretty place to come and stroll or sit and relax.

data.title: Relaxing and beautiful
data.text: A beautiful place to walk and look at the flowers,the grounds are well maintained. A lot of birds and sculptures to look at as you walk around the lake,even a very nice restaurant and brewery

data.title: Lovely formal garden in downtown Lakeland
data.text: If you're in Lakeland, make a short visit to Hollis Garden, which is a peaceful and lovely formal garden, often with classical music being piped in. It's close to Lake Mirror, which can also be a nice place to walk around.

data.title: lake mirror park
data.text:
This is a good place for walk,30 minutes is enough.  the scenery is excellent although it is small.
peaceful place filled with fresh air,clean ground,unforgetful swan building.

data.title: Peaceful
data.text: This place is not only gorgeous but peaceful. You can enjoy nature, silently seating on a bench while appreciating your surroundings. Beautiful gardens and fresh air. Lovely place.

data.title: Nice
data.text: Very nice to just walk around with your significant other or with the family there's a kiddie park on the other side because some nice tattoos cards are nice too very pleasant place to be

data.title: Just the Right Size
data.text:
If you enjoy visiting gardens, you'll love the fabulous Hollis Garden. Even though it is on the small side, it hosts more interesting plants in a compact area than about any other place. 

If you don't enjoy gardens, you'll really like Hollis Garden. Because of its size, you get to the good stuff right away. It doesn't take long to find and get to the uncommon edible fruit, vegetable, and herb plants that are on display. 

There are also several other themed gardens or outdoor rooms. The generally formal gardens are extremely well-kept by a knowledgeable staff. If you have a perplexing plant question, ask for Stacy.

Some of the best things in life are free. Hollis Garden is one of them.

data.title: Great Location for Family Pictures
data.text: The pretty landscape makes it the perfect spot for family photos.  Great please to stroll and admire the gardens.  Almost always a wedding taking place there.

data.title: Beautiful
data.text: I hate to say but the first time we stopped here (because we live a little aways from this area) was for Pokémon hunting. but I love coming here (even if its playing a game on our phone) the music is nice that they play and it is very relaxing and great for pictures. We walked around the pond and it's a great play to get some walking in for exercise.

data.title: Beautiful Gardens
data.text:
Great Atmosphere, beautiful gardens..all ti
Type of fruits and flowers..Great music all the Fountains and different paths..Beautiful place for Weddings and all Family Occasions

data.title: Wedding
data.text: Went here for ours sons outdoor wedding. Was really pretty . Nice gardens . ... Had reception at another place . But the gardens were really pretty .

data.title: Breathtaking
data.text: This is by far one of the best places to go to in Lakeland. Lakeland had spent a lot of money in investing in this garden. Hollis garden is a place that really defines what Lakeland is all about.

data.title: Pretty yearound
data.text: Was here last year and it hasn't went downhill at all. Always a beautiful site to see every time we visit.
